basics.name: Areeb Shah Mohammed
basics.label: Doctoral Student
basics.summary: Doctoral student at the math department of the Universität Innsbruck, interested in (applied) category theory in general and categorical probability in particular.

work.name: Department of Mathematics, Universität Innsbruck
work.summary: Employed as a member of the research staff funded by FWF P 35992-N during the course of my doctoral study.

courses: PhD study on the topic of Markov categories and their applications under the supervision of Dr. Tobias Fritz.

commentedOut_courses: Seminar: Theta functions, complex abelian varieties and moduli spaces
Seminar: Introduction to Stable Homotopy Theory
Derived Functors and Cohomology through Higher Categories
courses: Took courses in various fields of mathematics, focusing on category theory, homotopy theory, logic, and algebraic geometry.
Completed a thesis on the topic of higher semiadditivity under the supervision of Dr. Denis‑Charles Cisinski.
An undergraduate course in mathematics and computer science, with a wide foundation on algebra, analysis, algorithms, the theory of computation, and programming.
Additional final year electives focusing on algebraic topology, algebraic geometry, logic, and type theory.

publications.name: Partializations of Markov categories
publications.summary: We develop a construction of a class of positive quasi-Markov categories of spans from suitable Markov categories, called partializable Markov categories.

publications.name: Hidden Markov Models and the Bayes Filter in Categorical Probability
publications.summary: We use Markov categories to develop generalizations of the theory of Markov chains and hidden Markov models in an abstract setting.

publications.name: Empirical Measures and Strong Laws of Large Numbers in Categorical Probability
publications.summary: We axiomatize the notion of empirical measure in the context of categorical probability and prove a strong law of large numbers for it.

talks.title: Partializations of Markov categories
talks.summary: Delivered a talk on partializable Markov categories and their applications to categorical probability and restriction category theory.

talks.title: Partializations of Markov categories
talks.summary: Delivered a talk on a formulation of a category of partial stochastic maps particularly suitable for categorical probability.

talks.title: Bayesian Filtering and Smoothing in Markov categories
talks.summary: Delivered a talk on formulating Bayesian filtering, smoothing and associated algorithms in Markov categories.

talks.title: Hidden Markov Models and the Bayes Filter in Categorical Probability
talks.summary: Delivered a talk on formulating hidden Markov models and Bayesian filtering in Markov categories.
